original: Edström, Walter Simon, civilingenjör, direktör, Göteborg, f. 11/3/91 i Malmö av ’sjökapt. Simon Simonsson E. o. Maria Möller. G. 17 m. EHsa-beth Andersson. Barn: Göran f. 20, Ricardo 25, Clas-Walter 27. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 09, avg:ex. fr. KTH (E) 13. Avd:chef f. ASEA ryska dotterbol. i Petrograd 16-18, försäljn:-chef v. A-B Elektraverken i Sthlm 18-20, anst. v. Siemens-Schuckertwer-ke (SSW) i Berlin 21-22, dir. f. SSW avd :kont. i Gijön i Spanien 22-25, för-säljn:dir. f. SSW i Madrid 25-28, v. SSW i Berlin 28, ordf. i SSW expert-komm. f. und:sökn. av Titicacasjön s. kraftkälla 29-30, tekn. dir. f. SSW Transoceana A-B i Berlin 30-31, verkst. dir. i Eiektr. Svetsnings A-B i Gbg sed. 31. Led. av styr. f. detta föret, samt f. dess europ. dotterbol. sed. 31, ordf. i styr. f. A-B Pumpind. i Gbg, Sv. tekn:fören. ständ. komm. f. svetstekn. o. Svetstekn. fören., led. av överstyr, f. Sv:es verkst :fören., KAK v. krets, hand:kamm. i Gbg, Tekn. röntgencentr., A-B Sv. Hand:-banken i Gbg, Fören. f. Gbgs försvar o. Sv:es mekanförb., led. av arb :utsk. f. svetskomm. sed. 31, styr :led. o. kas-saförvalt. i Gbgs stads gas- o. elverk, led. av styr. f. Uti :svenskarnas fören., led. av Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti. lektoratavd., v. ordf. i GKSS 38-42, i Sociedad Sueco-Hispano-Ameri-cana i Gbg 33 o. 34, ordf. 35, pres. i Ro-tarykl. i Gbg 42-43. Mexik. konsul 34- 35, ’stab^sing. (öv :löjtn. tj :ställn.) 40-42. Hobbies: segL, godf, curling. RVO, IVA KjellbergSM 41.
translated: Edström, Walter Simon, engineer, director, Gothenburg, b. 11/3/91 in Malmö to 'captain Simon Simonsson E. and Maria Möller. Married since 1917 to Ehsa-beth Andersson. Children: Göran b. 1920, Ricardo b. 1925, Clas-Walter b. 1927. - Schooling: degree in Malmö in 1909, graduated from KTH (E) in 1913. Department manager of ASEA's Russian subsidiary in Petrograd from 1916-1918, sales manager of A-B Elektraverken in Stockholm from 1918-1920, employed by Siemens-Schuckertwer-ke (SSW) in Berlin from 1921-1922, director of the SSW department office in Gijön, Spain from 1922-1925, sales director of SSW in Madrid from 1925-1928, employed by SSW in Berlin in 1928, chair of the SSW expert committee for the investigation of the Titicaca Lake as a power source from 1929-1930, technical director of SSW Transoceana A-B in Berlin from 1930-1931, executive director of Elektr. Svetsnings A-B in Gothenburg since 1931. Member of the board of directors of this company and its European subsidiaries since 1931, chair of the board of A-B Pumpind. in Gothenburg, Swedish technical association standing committee for welding technology and Welding Technology Association member, member of the executive board of the Swedish Machinery Association, member of the KAK circuit, hand:kamm. in Gothenburg, Technical X-ray Center, A-B Swedish Hand:-banken in Gothenburg, Society for Gothenburg’s defense and Swedish mechanical federation, member of the labor committee for welding committee since 1931, board member and treasurer of Gothenburg's city gas and electricity works, member of the board of directors of the Uti:Swedish Fellowship organization, member of the National Association for Swedes Abroad in the lecturer department, vice chair of GKSS from 1938-1942, chair of the Sociedad Sueco-Hispano-Americana in Gothenburg in 1933 and 1934, chair in 1935, president of the Rotary club in Gothenburg from 1942-1943. Mexican consul from 1934-1935, staff lieutenant (reserve lieutenant rank) from 1940-1942. Hobbies: sailing, good food, and curling. Received the Order of Vasa (RVO), member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA), and the KjellbergSM award in 1941.

structured.name: Walter Simon Edström
structured.description: Walter Simon Edström was a Swedish engineer and director born on November 3, 1891, in Malmö to captain Simon Simonsson E. and Maria Möller.

awards.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences
